title: People, please, use the pick intent feature!
body:
It's actually a great option to try and build a functioning team.
I've become way too paranoid about picking Mordekaiser due to my last pick Jungler picking something like YI or Nidalee when I could have actually picked something with engage and hard CC top lane instead.

There's a reason this option's in the current champ select. I know we all want to play our soloQ hero one man army damage dealers but it won't mean a lot if we're going to lose in the long run due to a weak team comp.

//rant//

I never use pick intent.

For one, I don't want the enemy team to see my intended champion. Until Riot addresses this, pick intent is broken in my view. This mechanic discourages trades, because it broadcasts intended lane and gives opponents an opportunity to counter pick. Ambiguous role champions like Kayle/Echo lose the surprise if I'm showing Anivia before I switch.

Secondly, too often will my own team troll me. Not because my pick is weak (I don't play off-meta garbage because I want to win) but because my pick is strong. Second pick intended Xin? Nah I'm going to ban him instead of give you the chance to try and pick him. Nothing tilts me harder than having my own team ban out my intended pick.

So no, don't even use pick intent. It's a broken mechanic and a noob trap. INSTEAD, USE YOUR WORDS.

I am a support player and i need to adjust my champion picks on my and the enemy team.
Intent is not final. Your argument is invalid.

While it is a GREAT tool to communicate your intent to your team, it does the same for the enemy.

Say you are first pick and say you intend to pick Mordekaiser mid (for example).

Your last pick then says "Hey, can you grab me Riven, my main? I can pick you Morde"

Because it automatically selects your pick intent, the enemy team KNOWS that you want to play Mordekaiser.

Lo and behold, if any one of them is both paying attention and knows how to play your desired champion, they can snipe him away from you before your trade partner can pick him.

Then you are left with whatever champions that "Riven only diamond smurf" has on his account, and you have no way of guaranteeing that they have any champions you play.

Me and my friend snipe the enemy one trick ponys when we can, and it pisses off Vayne/Riven/Yasuo mains to no end.
